name: Islamic Relief USA
mission: Islamic Relief USA is working towards a world free of poverty.
programs: Programs for Vulnerable Families Across the United States
theoryOfChange: Islamic Relief Worldwide, of which Islamic Relief USA is an affiliate, utilizes a 'Maqasid framework' as its strategic approach to achieving impact. This framework is described as enabling the organization to achieve impact for the most marginalized families and communities. It emphasizes the sanctity of every individual's life and dignity, particularly their rights to security, health, a sustainable environment, food, shelter, and clean water. The framework guides their work in core areas such as food security and nutrition, sustainable livelihoods and employment, health, education, and water and sanitation. Islamic Relief's global strategy, which connects its programming with achieving positive change, is also guided by this framework. Islamic Relief USA also states that innovation is the cornerstone of its strategic process and aims to scale up evidence and results-based humanitarian programming.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 44/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; good program ratio (≥75%) suggests reasonable delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

judge_issues.message: Jargon detected in baseline narrative: 'asnaf categories'

score_details.score_summary: Islamic Relief USA earns 72/100 due to exceptional alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://irusa.org/zakat (Source: https://irusa.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: Islamic Relief USA holds a 100.0/100 score with a program expense ratio of 80.3%, 18.0 months of working capital, and $0.17 fundraising efficiency.
The organization is zakat-eligible and follows specific asnaf categories for distribution.
The organization reported total revenue of $165,235,589.
IRUSA provided support for forcibly displaced families in Sudan and served people via Bahri Hospital.
Programs include the rehabilitation of Bahri Hospital and fortification of the Palestinian medical sector.
The charity provides multiple donation options and methods for humanitarian giving.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong overall rating due to its perfect financial health score and high alignment with Muslim donor values through its zakat-certified programs.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing the directness of impact reporting to move beyond service delivery metrics toward long-term outcome data [4].
Increasing the availability of cost-per-beneficiary data to further improve impact transparency [1].

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for donors seeking humanitarian causes, specifically those requiring zakat-eligible options [2][6]. Its long track record of serving forcibly displaced families and responding to urgent international crises establishes it as a high-fit organization for the Muslim community [4][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: IRUSA demonstrates moderate impact through direct service delivery, such as rehabilitating the Bahri Hospital and fortifying the Palestinian medical sector [4][5]. While the organization manages a total revenue of $165,235,589 and maintains high financial accountability, the impact score reflects a need for more granular cost-effectiveness data [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: Islamic Relief USA is a premier humanitarian organization dedicated to alleviating global poverty through zakat-eligible emergency relief and sustainable development programs.
strengths: Maintains a perfect Charity Navigator score of 100.0/100, indicating exceptional transparency and financial health [1].
High operational efficiency with a program expense ratio of 80.3% and a fundraising efficiency of $0.17 per $1 raised [1][3].
Robust liquidity with 18.0 months of working capital available to sustain operations [1].
baseline_narrative.summary: Islamic Relief USA (IRUSA) operates as a non-profit organization providing international and domestic humanitarian aid, including COVID-19 response and support for vulnerable families [1][4]. The organization is verified as zakat-eligible, maintaining a specific policy to distribute funds according to established asnaf categories [2].

all_citations.claim: perfect 100/100 overall score from Charity Navigator

all_citations.quote: Islamic Relief USA is a zakat-eligible organization.

all_citations.claim: supporting 15,268 forcibly displaced families in Sudan
all_citations.quote: Forcibly displaced families supported in Sudan: 15,268

all_citations.claim: fortifying the Palestinian medical sector for 420,204 individuals

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong overall rating due to its perfect financial health score and high alignment with Muslim donor values through its zakat-certified programs.

areas_for_improvement.context: While IRUSA reports high-level beneficiary counts, it currently <cite id="1">lacks granular cost-per-beneficiary data</cite> which would allow for more precise impact comparisons.

The organization holds <cite id="1">18.0 months of working capital</cite>, which is significantly higher than the industry recommendation of 1-3 months, suggesting funds could be deployed more rapidly.

bbb_assessment.summary: Currently does not meet BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards for Charity Accountability based on the latest review.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is expanding its outcome tracking through Candid to improve impact transparency.
risk_factors: <cite id="1">18.0 months of working capital</cite> may indicate slow deployment of donor funds.
<cite id="1">No third-party RCT-level impact evaluations</cite> are currently available.
case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="1">excessive financial reserves</cite> and a lack of granular cost-efficiency data.

confidence.data_freshness: Financial data from 2023; Impact data from 2025 catalog
confidence.notes: Strong alignment between financial reporting and third-party ratings.

alignment.explanation: The organization is a high-fit for Muslim donors, offering <cite id="2">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and serving <cite id="2">traditional asnaf categories</cite> in high-urgency humanitarian zones.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust IRUSA due to its <cite id="1">perfect Charity Navigator score</cite> and its <cite id="1">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite>. The organization has been <cite id="4">operating for over 30 years</cite> with a fully independent board.
credibility.improvement: To further enhance credibility, the organization could <cite id="1">complete the BBB Wise Giving Alliance accreditation</cite>, as it currently meets 0 of 20 standards according to their latest review.

impact.explanation: IRUSA demonstrates high efficiency with an <cite id="3">80.3% program expense ratio</cite>. They provide direct services, such as <cite id="5">rehabilitating hospitals to serve 1.5 million people</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="1">tracking cost-per-beneficiary</cite> to help donors understand the specific ROI of their contributions.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Verified outcomes but no RCTs

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Distributes significant funding to local implementing partners and community centers

rich_narrative.headline: Islamic Relief USA is a premier humanitarian organization dedicated to alleviating global poverty through zakat-eligible emergency relief and sustainable development programs.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to fulfill their zakat through a highly established, transparent, and large-scale institution with a proven track record in major global crisis zones.
donor_motivations: Want to ensure 100% zakat compliance through verified asnaf categories
Value top-tier transparency ratings from third-party evaluators
Prefer supporting an organization with significant infrastructure and reach
Are motivated by urgent humanitarian needs in the Muslim world
giving_considerations: Gifts support a large-scale operation with significant financial reserves
Impact is reported through service delivery metrics rather than academic studies
The organization acts as both a direct service provider and a major grantmaker
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking small, grassroots organizations with low overhead or those who require rigorous RCT evidence for every dollar spent.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects verified outcome tracking and a strong theory of change, but a lack of independent, experimental impact evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: IRUSA utilizes a faith-based framework to provide emergency relief and sustainable development, focusing on immediate life-saving aid and long-term resilience.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that large-scale humanitarian interventions are actually improving long-term stability for displaced families.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Despite large reserves, the scale of humanitarian crises in Gaza and Sudan creates a continuous and massive funding gap.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="1">perfect 100/100 CN score</cite> while peers have a <cite id="1">median program expense ratio of 80.3%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: More significant focus on domestic US community services
similar_organizations.name: ICNA Relief

similar_organizations.differentiator: Specialized focus on nutrition and water security
similar_organizations.name: Action Against Hunger USA

similar_organizations.differentiator: Stronger emphasis on policy advocacy and systemic change
similar_organizations.name: Oxfam America

strengths.detail: The organization holds a <cite id="1">perfect 100.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite> and a Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid, indicating top-tier governance.
IRUSA directs <cite id="3">80.3% of its total expenses to programs</cite> and maintains a fundraising efficiency of <cite id="1">$0.17 per $1 raised</cite>.
The charity provides <cite id="2">clear zakat guidance</cite> and distributes funds across five specific asnaf categories, including the <cite id="2">poor, needy, and wayfarers</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Islamic Relief USA's financial stability is a primary strength, evidenced by <cite id="1">18.0 months of working capital</cite> available to sustain operations during economic fluctuations. This fiscal prudence is matched by a robust grantmaking capacity, with the organization distributing <cite id="3">$107,825,407 in total grants</cite> in 2023 to both domestic and international partners. Their impact in specific crisis zones is quantifiable; for instance, their work in Sudan provided <cite id="4">direct service to 100,000 people via Bahri Hospital</cite>. Furthermore, the organization maintains a <cite id="1">100% independent board</cite>, ensuring that governance remains objective and focused on the mission of poverty alleviation.
rich_narrative.summary: Islamic Relief USA (IRUSA) is a premier humanitarian organization that has been <cite id="1">operating since 1994</cite> to alleviate global poverty through faith-based service. As a major international NGO, the organization reported <cite id="3">$165,235,589 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year, demonstrating significant scale in its ability to address humanitarian crises. IRUSA maintains a <cite id="1">perfect 100/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting a high standard of accountability and financial health. The organization is <cite id="2">verified as zakat-eligible</cite>, with a dedicated policy ensuring funds reach the <cite id="2">fuqara (poor), masakin (needy), and other traditional asnaf categories</cite>. Its operations are highly efficient, maintaining a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 80.3%</cite>, which ensures the vast majority of donor contributions directly fund relief efforts. IRUSA's reach is extensive, providing aid across <cite id="4">Sudan, Gaza, Pakistan, Yemen, and Lebanon</cite>. Recent impact data highlights their critical role in conflict zones, such as <cite id="4">supporting 15,268 forcibly displaced families in Sudan</cite> and <cite id="5">fortifying the Palestinian medical sector for 420,204 individuals</cite>. By combining professional humanitarian standards with Islamic values, IRUSA serves as a vital bridge between Muslim donors and vulnerable communities worldwide.
